sentences.en: At midnight, the German flag will be raised over the Reichstag.
sentences.cn: 半夜时，德国国旗将在德国国会大厦升起。

sentences.en: By midnight the crowd had thinned.
sentences.cn: 半夜时分，人群渐渐散去了。

sentences.en: By the time he arrived, it was well past midnight (= after midnight ) .
sentences.cn: 他到的时候早已经是后半夜了。

sentences.en: Church bells pealed at the stroke of midnight.
Customers are welcome to linger over coffee until around midnight.
sentences.cn: 客人尽可以喝着咖啡逗留到午夜左右。

sentences.en: Franklin did not turn up until well after midnight.
sentences.cn: 富兰克林直到午夜过后很久才出现。

sentences.en: George livens up after midnight, relaxing a little.
sentences.cn: 午夜过后，乔治来了劲，人也活跃起来。

sentences.en: He fell asleep just past midnight with tolerable ease.
sentences.cn: 他刚过午夜就睡着了，睡得还算安稳。

sentences.en: He gave reporters the slip by leaving at midnight.
sentences.cn: 他在午夜时分离开，避开了记者的追踪。

sentences.en: He’s gone for a midnight swim.
It is totally out of the question to postpone the midnight deadline.
sentences.cn: 想要推迟午夜的最后期限是完全不可能的。

sentences.en: Some time after midnight, he retired to bed.
The break-in had occurred just before midnight.
sentences.cn: 这次非法闯入就发生在午夜前。

sentences.en: The racket of drills and electric saws went on past midnight.
sentences.cn: 钻孔机和电锯的噪声过了半夜还继续响着。

sentences.en: The singing and carousing did not end until after midnight.
sentences.cn: 人们把酒纵歌，一直闹腾到后半夜。

sentences.en: Well we did have a midnight feast, me and my sister.
sentences.cn: 我和姐姐的确在半夜大吃了一顿。

sentences.en: You can’t phone her now – it’s gone midnight (= after midnight ) !
sentences.cn: 你现在不能打电话给她，都过午夜了！

phrases.tran_cn: n. 夜半太阳（夏季在南极或北极能见到）

trans.tran_en: Midnight is used to describe something that happens or appears at midnight or in the middle of the night
